body.p: Rank the following proteins from most to least abundant in plasma.

feedback.p: Correct. Albumin accounts for 60% of plasma proteins, more than either of the other choices.
Incorrect. Albumin accounts for 60% of plasma proteins, more than either of the other choices.
Incorrect. Albumin accounts for 60% of plasma proteins, more than either of the other choices.

hint.p: Albumin is largely responsible for plasma osmotic pressure.

feedback.p: Incorrect. While Globulins encompass a wide variety of proteins that transport lipids, steroid hormones and other substances in the blood. They only make up 36% of plasma proteins.

Correct. Globulins encompass a wide variety of proteins that transport lipids, steroid hormones and other substances in the blood. They make up 36% of plasma proteins, the second largest proportion of proteins in this list.

Incorrect. Globulins encompass a wide variety of proteins that transport lipids, steroid hormones and other substances in the blood. They make up 36% of plasma proteins, while another protein makes up a smaller portion.

hint.p: Together, globulins make up about 1/3 of plasma.

feedback.p: Incorrect. Plasma consists of only 0.2 - 0.4% fibrinogen.
Incorrect. Plasma consists of only 0.2 - 0.4% fibrinogen.
Correct. Plasma consists of only 0.2 - 0.4% fibrinogen.

hint.p: Fibrinogen makes up a very small portion of plasma.
